title.narrative: OUTPUT 7.7 ENVIRONMENT AND CLIMATE

description.narrative: Output 7 (Environment and climate): National and subnational governments have improved capacity to address climate and environmental risks for most vulnerable children through innovative climate smart solutions, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children in development and humanitarian settings.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 7 (Environment and climate): National and subnational governments have improved capacity to address climate andenvironmental risks for most vulnerable children through innovative climate smart solutions

description.narrative: UNICEF has implemented new initiatives to strengthen capacity development and raise awareness on child-centred climate and environment actions, actively engaging with key government stakeholders and young people. Climate change and environmental degradation issues are advocated as cross-cutting issues across children-relevant sectors to support mainstreaming of ambitious child-focused climate and environment policies and actions. Notably, UNICEF has initiated a Climate Landscape Analysis for Children (CLAC) and policy advocacy and awareness-raising on child-sensitive climate and environment actions in the WASH and health sectors.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/12/2021
